Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ronyi> https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbestechcouncil/2018/12/28/saas-in-blockchain/#2f3952fd2e1f

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> @shitcoin_shaman You will not lose your balance of vrsc, as the main fork will continue on. If you're staking(POS) your balance you'll need to update your wallet(0.5). If you mining(POW) you'll need to have the latest miner or wallet supporting verushash 2.0, depending if you're mining solo(wallet 0.5) or pool(nheqminer).

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <shitcoin_shaman> Thank you for replying @zpajk

I was worried I'd lose my funds if I didn't update before tonight.

Phew , panic over.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ùî™ùî¨ùî≤ùî´ùî±ùîûùî¶ùî´ùî°ùîØùî¶ùî£ùî±ùî¢ùîØ> What are you talking about? Still looks like  20Th of  the networks 27TH is still going strong. Many are still here. http://vrsc.52hash.com/stats The thing I am noticing is a lot of F*** FPGA sentiment. I am under the impression that Verus isn't necessarily against FPGA's, in fact they seem to  be support by the VRSC community. It is just that it turns out FPGA's had a unfair advantage in VH1, and VH2 is aimed to even the playing field,  not necessarily get rid of them like some coins have tried with ASICS. I may be missing the point here, but what draws me to this coin is the concept of trying to include all types of miners on as even of a playing field as possible

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <kryptoshi> @ùî™ùî¨ùî≤ùî´ùî±ùîûùî¶ùî´ùî°ùîØùî¶ùî£ùî±ùî¢ùîØ  The VRSC team is doing the right thing. I would add they are doing more than I would do if I was in their situation. Working with the FPGA developers to try to get them to slow down their devices is a losing battle and shouldn't even be offered. Especially considering the secret mining they did; that act could be considered an act of aggression against their project and shouldn't be rewarded with cooperation. IMHO
